subNodes.conversationText: Greetings, dhaerow. When I first saw you here, I must confess that I was concerned. But I have been watching you, and realize you mean no harm.
I am glad that you can speak civilly to me, darthiir.
Indeed--My kinsmen accuse me of being courteous to a fault.  But courtesy is hard to fault, in my opinion.
Appearances can be deceiving, but in this case you are right.
This makes me glad.  Now, what can I do for you?  You are new here, and an adventurer, so I suppose you are full of questions.
What can you tell me of this region?
The area is very wild.  Drawn Swords is an outpost; the land between here and Evereska is dangerous, vast, and largely untraveled.  To the southwest, on the other hand, is Northdark Wood.
The Wood, too, is dangerous, but not so wild as the Backlands.  Travelers between Drawn Swords and Sunset Vale use roads that run through the less densely overgrown parts.
The elves of Evereska call Northdark "Reluvethel's Wood."  Reluvethel was a ranger who hunted orcs and trolls in this region many years ago--long before Swordskeep was built.
Tell me more about this ranger.
You mentioned an elf named Reluvethel.  What more can you tell me of him?

Many elves claim mastery of the bow, but according to legend Reluvethel was favored by Solonor Thelandira himself.  He could send an arrow from a mountaintop that would find the eye of an orc in the valley.

He was lost, like many elven heroes, in the Weeping War, perishing at the hands of a dread yugoloth in the Siege of Dlabraddath.  His tomb, it is said, lies somewhere in the the Wood.  If that is true, it is almost certainly protected.
Tell me a bit of the folk of Drawn Swords.
You have probably already met the most important people in town--Hamfast, our smith and de facto leader; Danmar; and Ianth, the paladin.

Besides Hamfast, there are two merchants in town. Oudin Asterchord sells curiosities, some of which are quite valuable. And then there's Hezro, over in yonder corner.  Hezro's not a very honest fellow, but he has wares that adventurers like you sometimes need.

Last--and perhaps least--are the men of Saern's Swords, an old militia company.  They don't get much done these days, especially because of the presence of true warriors like Revelian, me, and Mistress Ianth.
You have probably already met the most important people in town--Hamfast, our smith and de facto leader; Danmar; and Ianth, who now travels with you.

Besides Hamfast, there are two merchants in town. Oudin Asterchord sells curiosities, some of which are quite valuable. And then there's Hezro, over in yonder corner.  Hezro's not a very honest fellow, but he has wares that adventurers sometimes need.

Last--and perhaps least--are the men of Saern's Swords, an old militia company.  They don't get much done these days, especially because of the presence of more experienced warriors like me, my kinsman Revelian--and you, Mistress Ianth.
I thank you for the compliment, Deleuthelis.
What can I do for you?  You are new here, and an adventurer, so I suppose you are full of questions.
I have no questions at the moment.  Farewell.
Ah, my <brother/sister>, it is good to see another of our kind here.  The People sometimes have occasion to pass through the Sword and Dragon Inn, but seldom for long.
Greetings to you.  If that is the case, why are you here?
This inn makes Drawn Swords something of a diamond in the rough--the rough that is the Backlands.  It is a free settlement and a safe haven, and we elves have an interest in keeping it that way.
I would like to ask you something else.
As I said before, we elves have an interest in protecting free settlements in the Backlands.  I may not have mentioned that Danmar Braceley, the innkeeper, is an elf-friend of the highest order.
Greetings.  I am Deleuthelis, guard for the Sword and Dragon Inn.
You return.  How may I serve you?
What can you tell me of this region?
The area is very wild.  Drawn Swords is an outpost; the land between here and Evereska is dangerous, vast, and largely untraveled.  To the southwest, on the other hand, is Northdark Wood.
The Wood, too, is dangerous, but not so wild as the Backlands.  Travelers between Drawn Swords and Sunset Vale use roads that run through the less densely overgrown parts.
The elves of Evereska call Northdark "Reluvethel's Wood."  Reluvethel was a ranger who hunted orcs and trolls in this region many years ago--long before Swordskeep was built.
Tell me more about this ranger.
You mentioned an elf named Reluvethel.  What more can you tell me of him?

Many elves claim mastery of the bow, but according to legend Reluvethel was favored by Solonor Thelandira himself.  He could send an arrow from a mountaintop that would find the eye of an orc in the valley.

He was lost, like many elven heroes, in the Weeping War, perishing at the hands of a dread yugoloth in the Siege of Dlabraddath.  His tomb, it is said, lies somewhere in the the Wood.  If that is true, it is almost certainly protected.
Tell me a bit of the folk of Drawn Swords.
You have probably already met the most important people in town--Hamfast, our smith and de facto leader; Danmar; and Ianth, the paladin.

Besides Hamfast, there are two merchants in town. Oudin Asterchord sells curiosities, some of which are quite valuable. And then there's Hezro, over in yonder corner.  Hezro's not a very honest fellow, but he has wares that adventurers like you sometimes need.

Last--and perhaps least--are the men of Saern's Swords, an old militia company.  They don't get much done these days, especially because of the presence of true warriors like Revelian, me, and Mistress Ianth.
You have probably already met the most important people in town--Hamfast, our smith and de facto leader; Danmar; and Ianth, who now travels with you.

Besides Hamfast, there are two merchants in town. Oudin Asterchord sells curiosities, some of which are quite valuable. And then there's Hezro, over in yonder corner.  Hezro's not a very honest fellow, but he has wares that adventurers sometimes need.

Last--and perhaps least--are the men of Saern's Swords, an old militia company.  They don't get much done these days, especially because of the presence of more experienced warriors like me, my kinsman Revelian--and you, Mistress Ianth.
I thank you for the compliment, Deleuthelis.
I was just saying hello.  Farewell.
It is good to see you again.
